articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Bloomberg won't rule out spending $1B on race even if he's not nominee
articles.description: Former NYC Mayor Michael Bloomberg is open to spending a billion dollars of his own money on the 2020 race, even if he does not win the nomination and even if the nominee is Sen. Sanders or Sen. Warren, according to the NYT.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Report further connects Trump's impeachment fears, airstrike
articles.description: Questions about why Trump authorized the Jan. 3 airstrike aren't about catching him in a lie or playing "gotcha."
articles.content: The official White House explanation for the airstrike that killed Iranian Gen. Qassem Soleimani – or more accurately, explanations – can no longer be taken seriously. Donald Trump and his team have changed direction several times, in meandering and contradic… [+2087 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Congressman explains voting against War Powers resolution
articles.description: Rep. Max Rose, D-NY, discusses his vote against the War Powers Resolution and the death of Gen. Soleimani.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Stepping on his team's message, Trump contradicts his Iran policy
articles.description: Trump's entire Iran policy is based on trying to get officials in Tehran to negotiate. Now, however, Trump says he no longer wants to negotiate.
articles.content: The Trump administration’s Iran policy is known as the maximum pressure campaign, and it’s predicated on a relatively straightforward idea: the U.S. will impose such severe burdens on Iran that officials in Tehran will have no choice but to come to the table,… [+2329 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Near half of Sanders supporters have 'extreme enthusiasm'
articles.description: Supporters of Sen. Bernie Sanders have 'extreme enthusiasm' for the 2020 candidate, according to new polling from Iowa. Vaughn Hillyard discusses.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Even Trump's Pentagon chief won't back him up on airstrike claim
articles.description: Trump believes he was justified in launching a dangerous airstrike because Iran was targeting four US embassies. His own Pentagon chief won't back him up.
articles.content: It’s been 10 days since Donald Trump authorized an airstrike in Iraq that killed Iranian Gen. Qassem Soleimani, which was launched in order to prevent an imminent attack. Well, maybe not imminent. But the president and his team certainly knew of a deadly atta… [+2989 chars]

articles.title: Sanders and Warrens statistically tied in Iowa
articles.description: New 2020 polling shows Sens. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren are in a statistical tie in Iowa. The panel discusses.
